## Introduction
Oven Roasted Rosemary Chicken is a classic dish that combines the aromatic flavors of rosemary with tender and juicy chicken. This recipe is a perfect choice for a family dinner or a special occasion. The rosemary adds a fragrant and earthy taste to the chicken, making it a delicious and comforting meal.

## Ingredients
- 4 chicken breasts
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons fresh rosemary, chopped
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper

## Equipment
- Baking dish
- Mixing bowl
- Knife
- Cutting board
- Measuring spoons

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 25 minutes

## Steps
1. Preheat the oven to 425째F (220째C).
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the olive oil, chopped rosemary, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper.
3. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish and pour the rosemary mixture over them. Make sure to coat the chicken evenly.
4. Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and roast for 25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and golden brown.
5. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving.
6. Serve the Oven Roasted Rosemary Chicken hot with your favorite side dishes.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Oven Roasted Rosemary Chicken with roasted vegetables and mashed potatoes for a complete and satisfying meal.
- Pair it with a fresh green salad and crusty bread for a lighter option.

## Variations
- For a citrus twist, add the juice and zest of one lemon to the rosemary mixture before coating the chicken.
- Substitute fresh rosemary with dried rosemary if fresh is not available. Use 1 tablespoon of dried rosemary instead of 2 tablespoons of fresh rosemary.

## Tips and Tricks
- Make sure to pat dry the chicken breasts before coating them with the rosemary mixture. This will help the mixture adhere better to the chicken.
- If you prefer a crispier skin, you can broil the chicken for a couple of minutes after roasting.
- Adjust the amount of salt and pepper according to your taste preferences.

## Nutritional Information

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- To reheat, place the chicken in a preheated oven at 350째F (175째C) for about 10-15 minutes or until heated through.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use bone-in chicken instead of chicken breasts?
   - Yes, you can use bone-in chicken thighs or drumsticks for this recipe. Adjust the cooking time accordingly.

2. Can I use dried rosemary instead of fresh rosemary?
   - Yes, you can use dried rosemary as a substitute. Use 1 tablespoon of dried rosemary instead of 2 tablespoons of fresh rosemary.

3. Can I marinate the chicken in the rosemary mixture overnight?
   - Yes, marinating the chicken overnight will enhance the flavor. Make sure to refrigerate the marinated chicken.

4. Can I use skinless chicken breasts?
   - Yes, you can use skinless chicken breasts for a healthier option. The cooking time may vary slightly, so make sure to check for doneness.

5. Can I freeze the Oven Roasted Rosemary Chicken?
   - Yes, you can freeze the cooked chicken for up to 3 months. Thaw it in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.
